author: Patrick Allan
title: Easily Saw Through PVC Pipe, ABS Pipe, and Nylon Rope With Mason's Line
text:
Go to permalink 
Some pipes are in spots too tight to fit a saw or other tool for cutting. Mason’s line, a cheap, sturdy nylon string can get the job done, and quickly saw through other things like rope too. 
In this video from the Essential Craftsmen YouTube channel , you’ll learn how to use mason’s line, and see how well it actually works. Just string the line underneath what you need to cut and alternate pulling each end. The mason’s line cuts through so easily because it’s slightly abrasive, and the back and forth motion causes friction and heat, which melts through plastics easily.
